Reviews.Title: “Location was our only complaint...”
Reviews.Author: jrts
Reviews.Content: Room was a good size, clean and comfortable. Location wasn't what we considered great as there's nothing much around the hotel. The hotel is located on an upper floor of a building in a fairly quiet area and is fairly close to the HBF ad U train stations.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel, but clean and decent”
Reviews.Author: qu_tee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Berlin Hauptbahnhof and less than a 5 minute walk from Naturkundemuseum, which is the nearest station on the U6 line. By the time we arrived it was late and it was a bit harder to find this place as it is not a hotel on its own, but instead shares the building with other places and you have to ring the buzzer and then go to the reception on the S5 floor (the entry is a bit eerie in the dark). I believe the room we got was one of the larger rooms which had floor to ceiling entry doors and windows, so obviously the room was quite spacious and a good size. The overall impression though is that this is probably a bit more of a hostel than a hotel. The room has a small TV, towels, firm beds and in-built body wash dispensers. There was no tea or coffee making facilities and no phone to contact reception. Overall though the room was clean and provided the bare essentials. Our TV did not work at all when we arrived and the receptionist was very quick to resolve the problem. Free wifi is available throughout the building and you just need to get the login codes from reception. Location of this hotel is a bit further out of the city, but still ok. You can walk into the main city area in 20-30 minutes or train it in which is fairly easy. There are 2 small supermarkets about a 5 minute walk away (they close at 8pm), Subway and some other food places as well a bit further down the street (Chausseestraße). We didn’t pay for the hotel breakfast as I didn’t think it would be worth the 7EU each and we just got stuff from the supermarket instead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable simple hotel near Berlin's centre”
Reviews.Author: MichaelScholl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mikon Eastgate Hotel for a long weekend to attend a scientific symposium at the Natural History Museum (Museum für Naturkunde) of Berlin. The hotel was perfectly located being located less than a hundred meters from the Museum itself. The main reception which is open 24 hours a day is located on the fifth floor of the building, near the terrace and the breakfast room. Breakfast is well priced at 7.5 Euros and was buffet style catering for everyone's tastes. The single room was clean, very large, light and comfortable with two large windows open on an open space between the buildings, a desk, cupboard and a large en-suite bathroom. The hotel also offered free high-speed WIFI access in the room which is always greatly appreciated. The hotel is situated less than 20 minutes easy walk to the centre of Berlin and the main tourist attractions. I would most definitely return and stay at the hotel especially for business purposes, but maybe not for a romantic escapade.

Reviews.Title: “Typical GDR Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viktor K
Reviews.Content: Located in the eastern part of Berlin with more soviet style atmosphere, this hotel is on the top floor of the building, so you always come in like to the appartments. Staff is mostly from former soviet countries(also from my homecity Odessa). The room was quite poor, but clean. Breakfast was not so nice, better to eat somewhere else. Bathroom was also clean and tidy. The hotel is 10 minutes walking to Brandenburg Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: pillang0
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of the major attractions (Brandenburg gate, Reichstag, Topography of terror, Unter den Linden, Checkpoint Charly, Berlin Chatedral, Museum Island etc... Easy to access from thr Airport Schöfeld (by train to the " Hauptbahnhof " then 800 meters walk to the hotel) The rooms are situated the 4th and 5th floors of the building with a wonderful views of the city. (Television tower and Reichstag glassdome) The room was simple but comfortable with a large shower. The staff was friendly and helpful. Finally I recommend: cheap price, good location, comfortable room

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: malley8
Reviews.Content: the size of the room was almost luxurious. we were shocked! :) big bathroom, fan available, no minibar. reception is on the 5th floor. the only problem it is a bit far both from the central station (it takes at least 15 mins on foot) both from the city centre. prices are average but we did not bought the breakfast so i don't know how it is.

Reviews.Title: “Except for the location it was average”
Reviews.Author: IronicalDestiny
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. It is very close to Berlin HBF. It is walkable to the Parliament house and few other places of interest. The service os ok. The breakfast was not worth it. There was no intercom in the room. The only was to speak to the reception was to walk up to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic but clean and close to UBahn.......”
Reviews.Author: Prabz0507
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frlll, basic but generally clean place to stay if you are in Berlin for 1 day or 2. When we opened the door to our room, it was uncleaned, beds not made from earlier guests that have checked out. The lady at the counter seemed shocked when we informed her, she was quick to apologise and offered us some drinks while she located someone to clean it after a few hours. Besides the basics (bed/cupboard) and free wifi there is nothing else to shout about. Bathrooms were clean though. They allowed us to store our luggage in a makeshift room when we checked out and use of a toilet. The counter lady on the next day (Vesa) was extremely kind, gentle and aloowed us to rest at the breakfast area and also offered us drinks and biscuits while we waited to catch our train. Somestimes small kind gestures like this makes up for the lack of other facilities...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: LJ2009London
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the metro station and can walk to Fredrichstase station, we actually walked most places. Clean large rooms, fairly basic facilities, there is no fridge or tea/coffe but is good for the price! much better than staying in a hostel. This hotel is part of an appartment building (it is not just a hotel building) Staff dont speak much english but we got by fine, chose to eat out for breakfast rather than get the hotel breakfast Make sure you check out the restaurants and bars on Oranienburger Str just down the read! Would stay here again or something on Oranienburger Str

Reviews.Title: “Close to Hauptbahnhof and U-bahn.”
Reviews.Author: opa124
Reviews.Content: Convenient for Main Station and U/S-bahn. Breakfast good value (5euros), comfort room large and adequate but lights dim. Additional services such as availability of drinks and snacks or comlementary tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms would have been appreciated. The shared entrance and hallway were not clean and created a poor first impression of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice, comfortable, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: bartn7777
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, next to the new main train station in Berlin. Close to U-Bahn. There is wathed Parking lot for 3 EUR a day! The Hotel is very clean and you can have good breakfest for additional 5,00 EUR. The room I had (409) is quite large with nice loggia on street side. The bathroom was big enaough and clean. There was flat TV but no refrigerator and no AC. The beds are comfortable. The price/quality ratio is very good! I can advise this hotel. There was no free internet access.

HotelInfo.Name: Mikon Eastgate Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hessische Str 10, 10115 Berlin, Germany
